verses.verse: Now Hiram<WH2438> king<WH4428> of Tyre<WH6865> sent<WH7971> messengers<WH4397> to David<WH1732> with cedar<WH730> trees,<WH6086> masons,<WH2796> <WH7023> and carpenters,<WH2796> <WH6086> to build<WH1129> a house<WH1004> for him.

And David<WH1732> realized<WH3045> that the Lord<WH3068> had established<WH3559> him as king<WH4428> over<WH5921> Israel,<WH3478> [and] that his kingdom<WH4438> was highly<WH4605> exalted,<WH5375> for the sake<WH5668> of His people<WH5971> Israel.<WH3478>
Then David<WH1732> took<WH3947> more<WH5750> wives<WH802> at Jerusalem,<WH3389> and David<WH1732> became<WH3205> the father<WH3205> of more<WH5750> sons<WH1121> and daughters.<WH1323>
And these<WH428> are the names<WH8034> of the children<WH3205> born<WH3205> [to him] in Jerusalem:<WH3389> Shammua,<WH8051> Shobab,<WH7727> Nathan,<WH5416> Solomon,<WH8010>

When the Philistines<WH6430> heard<WH8085> that David<WH1732> had been anointed<WH4886> king<WH4428> over<WH5921> all<WH3605> Israel,<WH3478> all<WH3605> the Philistines<WH6430> went<WH5927> up in search<WH1245> of David;<WH1732> and David<WH1732> heard<WH8085> of it and went<WH3318> out against<WH6440> them.
Now the Philistines<WH6430> had come<WH935> and made<WH6584> a raid<WH6584> in the valley<WH6010> of Rephaim.<WH7497>

And David<WH1732> inquired<WH7592> of God,<WH430> saying,<WH559> "Shall I go<WH5927> up against<WH5921> the Philistines<WH6430>? And wilt Thou give<WH5414> them into my hand<WH3027>?" Then the Lord<WH3068> said<WH559> to him, "Go<WH5927> up, for I will give<WH5414> them into your hand.<WH3027>"

So they came<WH5927> up to Baal-perazim, and David<WH1732> defeated<WH5221> them there;<WH8033> and David<WH1732> said,<WH559> "God<WH430> has broken<WH6555> through<WH6555> my enemies<WH340> by my hand,<WH3027> like the breakthrough<WH6556> of waters.<WH4325>" Therefore<WH5921> <WH3651> they named<WH7121> <WH8034> that place<WH4725> Baal-perazim.
And they abandoned<WH5800> their gods<WH430> there;<WH8033> so David<WH1732> gave<WH559> the order<WH559> and they were burned<WH8313> with fire.<WH784>
And the Philistines<WH6430> made<WH6584> yet<WH5750> another<WH3254> raid<WH6584> in the valley.<WH6010>

And David<WH1732> inquired<WH7592> again<WH5750> of God,<WH430> and God<WH430> said<WH559> to him, "You shall not go<WH5927> up after<WH310> them; circle<WH5437> around<WH5437> behind<WH4480> <WH5921> them, and come<WH935> at them in front<WH4136> of the balsam<WH1057> trees.<WH1057>

"And it shall be when you hear<WH8085> the sound<WH6963> of marching<WH6807> in the tops<WH7218> of the balsam<WH1057> trees,<WH1057> then<WH227> you shall go<WH3318> out to battle,<WH4421> for God<WH430> will have gone<WH3318> out before<WH6440> you to strike<WH5221> the army<WH4264> of the Philistines.<WH6430>"

And David<WH1732> did<WH6213> just<WH9201> as God<WH430> had commanded<WH6680> him, and they struck<WH5221> down<WH5221> the army<WH4264> of the Philistines<WH6430> from Gibeon<WH1391> even as far<WH5704> as Gezer.<WH1507>
Then the fame<WH8034> of David<WH1732> went<WH3318> out into all<WH3605> the lands;<WH776> and the Lord<WH3068> brought<WH5414> the fear<WH6343> of him on all<WH3605> the nations.<WH1471>
